body:
My other desk's height was 30" and non-adjustable. I started feeling pain everyday in my armpits and shoulders after using it daily for months and discovered it was because I was raising them too much to type. I checked an ergonomic calculator and for my height (5"5) the ideal desk height is between 24.5" and 27". I searched a lot and it wasn't easy to find a desk that could be adjusted to this height until I found WFH deks. It's been about 3 weeks and my arm pain is gone!
The only thing is that unfortunately this desk is a bit too small for me, but it's nice so I'll save it for when my kids are older and can use it for studying. I know I can buy the shelve for the 2nd monitor or the side shelve for the laptop, but to me it was too expensive as it is to now have to spend more in these attachments but I guess I'm going to have to do it at some point if I want to keep using this desk because I can't fit a second monitor but obviously I knew that since I saw the pictures before buying it. I guess I was too optimistic. Also, the right height was a priority at the time of purchase.
title: Simple, easy to put together
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: I wanted a standing desk for a tight space and this WFH Tall standing desk fits well, is well designed and constructed, and looks good too. The tall version has room for a couple of shelves, now full of books. Because of the tight space I didn’t want the Back shelf as it adds about 10cm to the depth, and I needed the desk snug against the wall. Staff thought it might be able to be reversed, but not so. The other learning curve was before I realised that only the tall desk had enough slots for 2 shelves beneath - I thought I could choose one of the options and subtract parts that I didn’t need and add in the parts I wanted. But due to the manufacturing process, that wasn’t possible. I’d planned not to use the Cable tray so I had a full shelf for those books (and a cleaner line) but I think the desk shelf needs the support. It sloped a bit. So I’ve reassembled it with the cable tray and it’s working well. I’m enjoying the desk, and the move board too.

body: Truly a great experience to create an office nook in my living space. The desk took 10 mins to assemble, and customer service was quick to get back to me when I had a few questions on shipping. body:
Shopping was easy and shipping was fast. I bought it on sale--and probably wouldn't have made the purchase at full price, not because the product isn't worth the $, but because it would have been too expensive for me. 

I love how the product ships without the use of any styrofoam or plastic. Assembly instructions were printed directly on the inside of the box it was shipped in! 

It was relatively easy to assemble. It would have been easier with another pair of hands--the main desk portion is pretty heavy and it's a bit awkward trying to slide it in between the two sides while attached to the back panel. 

I bought the stand-up version of the work from home desk. In the space that it's in, I may need to readjust the desk for sitting down, but if I do that, the top shelf, which is the only part of the desk that is not adjustable, will be too high for the monitor. Not sure what to do about that. 

What blows my mind most about this desk is how absolutely rock-solid it is when assembled. I worried that a desk so thin, a desk without any screws or bolts or brackets of any kind might be flimsy. This is not a flimsy desk. And the finish is beautiful.

reply.title: Work From Home Desks
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
Overall, I am happy with this desk. I think it is attractive, I like how adjustable and customizable it is, and the sustainability/non toxic features mean a lot to me. The shipping was pretty fast (1 week) and there were only a couple minor dings. I would say 95% of the packaging was cardboard -- there was just a little plastic included but for such a large item, it was understandable. 

I think the design is very well thought out and creative. However, there are a couple things that I would change to make this a 5 star product. Perhaps these are things that must be sacrificed in order to make this product so adjustable and versatile but I think with some tweaking it could be really outstanding. 

The desk is relatively sturdy. For purely working purposes, I am not worried about it falling apart or anything like that. Just don't think it's as sturdy as other desks with 4 legs. I legit would use my old desk as a ladder sometimes if I needed to hang curtains or water my plants on higher shelves. I would NEVER stand on this desk. Even leaning on the standing portion, you can feel the desk "sag" just a little bit under the weight. It makes sense since it is only supported from one side. I'm also a bit clumbsy and if I bump into the desk, the whole thing will wobble which makes me nervous about putting my ceramic plants on the higher shelves (I'm doing it anyway cause it looks beautiful). This could be solved if you have one side leaning against the wall but that's not possible the way I have it set up. If you have large clumsy animals, just keep this in mind. 

Same thing goes with the attachable shelves. There is certainly some movement with these. The laptop wing especially has some sag and even though it is snug and secure, it does have a slight tilt to it so my laptop is not 100% straight. Again, I'm not worried about anything falling apart. I know my laptop is secure and after a while, the tilt is easy to ignore. 

The last thing I noticed was the "keys" that secure everything in place. I took some time figuring out exactly how I wanted this desk, which meant putting it together and taking it apart about 5 times the first night. A couple of the keys did chip a little from this. I'm not worried about it because now that I have the configuration set up how I want it, I'm not planning on taking it apart anytime soon. But if I were to be taking it down and putting it up regularly, I'd probably want to have a couple extra keys handy in case they continue chipping. 

Overall, I do really love my desk. I keep one side standing for my day job, and one side sitting for school/gaming. Compared to other "non toxic" desks on the market, I would still pick this one.
title: Beautiful, creative, versatile
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I've had this desk for about 3-4 months and can finally review. 
1. Putting it together- It's so satisfying. It's like trying to solve a very easy puzzle. Love that I didn't have to drill or turn a screw. 
2. Finding the right placement- it took me about 3 different configurations to finally settle on what I was most comfortable with. It's not super easy to go from writing to standing mode so I opted for standing- takes 5- 10 mins to change. 
3. Wear/ Maintenance- So far the Onyx color is easy to see marks and handprints. I constantly wipe down surfaces, which is ironic since it's black, but it's fine since I like the asthetic. I can see this desk moving with me over time. It forces me to not stockpile office supplies on my desk- that being said I would love if it had a some type of space to place all the pens and sticky notes.

body: My desk arrived on time and in perfect shape. I really appreciate that all of the packaging is recyclable paper and cardboard (no styrofoam, awesome!). The desktop is very stable and sturdy (and so are the shelves and monitor stand), and the adjustable height has made a big difference to my work day; my old desk was a touch too high, and this one is much more comfortable. In fact, this is easily the most comfortable and ergonomic desk I've ever used, whether in the office or at home. I bought a foot rest and the desk pad; these were sort of splurges, but honestly so worth it. The desk pad really does fit perfectly, and it's a very comfortable surface. I had one small issue, and Work From Home Desks had it taken care of in a half hour (at most) from when I sent them an email. Long story short, get this desk, you won't regret it. body: The desk is very cool, I love being able to modify it and add accessories. It's sleek and just gorgeous. I will say the large, main desk (at least on the sitting desk) is a bit wobbly, but not enough so that I wouldn't put one monitor on it if I needed to. I however, have the top shelf and I cannot reccomend it enough. It is solid. Zero wobble. I will eventually have two monitors with no trouble sitting up there. The laptop wing is so cool, it's a wonderfully simple design and works perfectly. I also have the footrest and two hooks for added convenience. I love how deep the main table is, I have plenty of room for my keyboard with number pad, mouse, small notebook, coffee/drink, etc. It's honestly worked out perfectly for me working from home 40 hours/week. I love it! Shipping got weird for me, apparently UPS didn't scan the first desk they sent to me, so it never made it - but I reached out to WFH Desks on IG and they were so quick to resolve the issue and get a replacement desk sent out. I had my desk just a few days later and setup took no more than 10 minutes, and that was me by myself. Most of the time I was trying to decide how high/low I wanted the main table to be. Super easy to assemble! Excellent customer service, quality product, cool aesthetic, definitely a happy customer.

body: I ordered a standard sitting desk. It arrived incredibly quickly during a really busy time of the year. When I mentioned these things I got a very quick response, a replacement desk top, the right pegs AND some bag hooks for good measure. This is not to say you should moan about insignificant things and rip these fine people off - but you should know that you are in very good hands. Thanks WFH desks - you guys are all round awesome - and I love your desk.

body:
My son was having his bedroom renovated and as he needed a desk to not only hold his Playstation, his school laptop and his video editing computer along with a large 32inch screen we had a bit of a challenge on our hands to find a desk that was sturdy enough but also compact enough to fit in the limited space and of course to accommodate everything.

After calling them and chatting about our predicament we ended up going with the 
WFH Desk, the Mid Shelf and for a bit of extra storage we added the Book Shelf Module and the Desk Pad, all in the black... very stylish ;)

It arrived super quick (3-4 days from memory) and was in perfect condition. Took less than 20mins to assemble and the great thing about it (over and above how cool it looked) was it had no screws or those annoying alan keys! It just fit together with these small 'wooden keys' all made out the of the same black finished plywood.

I really can't say anything bad about the product... 6 out 5!

body: Arrived well packaged and was easy for one person to put together. I did have to search online for how to assemble but found instructions on their website quickly and everything came together fairly intuitively. I gave it 4 stars because it's not an adjustable solution especially when adding extensions to the sides, and because desk attachments to the sides are somewhat unstable at the base since there's no cross support along the bottom attachment as you can see in their images on the site. However, I've got it permanently setup at standing desk height with an attached seated desk setup, so I won't need to take apart for options if I want to sit down. It's also slightly narrow in the width so if you are looking at standing mats or walking treadmill for underneath you'll need to take measurements carefully. Overall I'm very happy with my setup, and a standalone desk would be fantastic for dorms or a small office setup where you don't want to change the height very often.

reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: Not only is the desk amazing, but I also want to mention the great customer service. I reached out with questions prior to my purchase and they were so incredibly helpful and patient with all of my questions. I had questions when my desk arrived and their response time is impeccable. The desk itself is amazing! A little overwhelming when I first opened it up and went to put it together, but so easy to assemble even by myself. It took me 4-5 changes/ adjustments to find the right fit for me. That was a little time consuming, but now that I have it right I could not be more pleased. One comment I would make is that it is a bit of a pain to move any one component once assembled so making the 4-5 changes was frustrating, but way better than not having any options to changing the desk and just having to settle. I also like that I can continue to change it as needed if I want to. The only other comment I would make and this was a bit annoying for me, but my monitor does not fit on the shelves that come with this desk. It is a 27" monitor for reference. With the way I have made it work it unfortunately is in the way of my laptop on the lifter wing so I have to move my monitor any time I want to shut or open my laptop. If you plan to use this as a sitting desk keep that in mind. It does fit on their top shelf though, just too high to use if you are sitting. This is the only reason I am giving it 4 stars. I hope this is something they will adjust for the future!
title: Very Pleased

body: WFH shipped out my double wide desk module super fast ALL THE WAY across the country, and it arrived in perfect condition. It gives me so much flexibility without having to deconstruct anything. I keep my double wide module at sitting height and my main desk at standing height. I use my standing section (with or without a barstool) more in the daytime bc it's closer to the window, and I use my sitting desk (with a chair or an exercise ball) more at night because it is closer to my floor lamp. the top shelf make a perfect bookshelf for all my reading and textbooks while keeping my computer/writing surface free and clear, and the little L shaped backs of the main desk are perfect for little decorations, desk lamps, and notes of encouragement! And it's SOOOOO PRETTYYY! Everyone loves it, most of all me!
title: IN LOVE!!!!
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: I feel like I've been searching for the perfect desk for forever. They're either too large, too small, no storage, too bulky with storage, the list goes on. I stumbled upon WFH desks at the end of my futile desk search, just when I was about to give up and bam a miracle happened. The versatility is unheard of. I can add shelves as wings or I can place them below my desktop. I have a top shelf for a monitor stand or to place plants and other objects. Although it doesn't have any drawers, it can hold everything and still manage to create an open feel that doesn't make my room feel overcrowded. The wood is solid, every piece fits together as promised, and aside from the L side module, the desk can be put together by one person. I really like the coating on the wood, it feels protective against stains, and I also bought a desk pad which really just brightens up the entire space. Is it perfect, no - I have a couple of blemishes on my wood, including a split on my desktop that will need glue. This is disappointing considering how much I spent on it, but thanks to the never ending way the desk can be put together I can angle it facing down and out of harm's way for now. Also in the future I think they should consider making the wings with a bottom support (I get why they don't, they probably want to leave more ports open for versatility) but it's the only part of the desk that looks like it may be sagging slightly, or will sag in the future. Still I'm very happy with my purchase and look forward to seeing what accessories they will add in the future.
title: Game Changer
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I am so far happy with purchase. I wish instructuons were a little easier as a first time user but I figured it out. I’ll likely get some add ons. 

It would be cool if they included recommended standing heights for best posture.

body:
This desk has been a godsend. I live in a 375 sq foot apartment, so making a change to remote work definitely was something I'd have to think strategically about. I also have previously suffered from neck pain at my previous job. This desk was the answer to my problems.
The desk is bigger surface space and a smaller footprint than I though it would (both a plus) and it was wildly easy to put together. The parts are high quality craftsmanship and the price is attractive for the value. If you're considering the desk I highly recommend it. I asp have the hooks, laptop lifter, and the top shelf.

reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: I had a bit of trouble deciding which WFH desk to get. It's always nice to have a standing option, but when I really hammered it out, I need to sit for a lot of my job. So, I landed on the WFH Sitting Desk. The main draw for me was that I could adjust the height. I am short, and very few desks are customizable for short people. I tried out two heights before getting it just right, but now I am in LOVE with my new desk. Not only it is absolutely gorgeous (because it is), it has the perfect footprint -- the right size and goes with my Living Room decor, but it also exceeds my standards for earth sustainability. I added one shelf + a top shelf. I don't think I could live without the top shelf, its great. The only modification I would make is for the desk to have two more inches of height; one more 'space' would be very useful. First, because I would love the top shelf just a bit higher; and second, there are limited spaces to add hooks and accessories with just the four spaces. All in all, I am very happy and I recommend this desk!!! I plan to eventually try out the laptop shelf accessory. Its' great to know I can continue to customize my desk as circumstances change.

body: Such an innovative desk for a constantly changing situation. I needed something that wasn't too wide, to put in the corner of my living room, and with a raised laptop platform that didn't look like a gaming desk. After hours of amazon and Wayfair, I found WFH desks thru instagram. I love that you can customize with different pieces when you see the need. When I had to move back to an office, I took the desk with me and set up was like putting together a peg puzzle. So easy. Love it!
title: Super easy assembly, and strong!
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: I purchased my wfh desk about 9 months into stay at hone orders came I to effect. It was quite the investment but my employer let me know we would be working remotely for a long time so I felt okay with splurging. I purchased the standing desk bundle which came with extra hooks and a laptop side shelf. Months later I still use my desk. It’s really nice and is aesthetically pleasing. It’s fairly easy to put together. However some of the pieces chipped fairly easy. I definitely recommend having 1 person help you, it will just make things quicker. I do wish it were easier to transition from standing to sitting. My work equipment includes a monitor, a laptop, and a docking station. It has taken me a while to figure out the best co figuration to fit everything on the desk. I loved the look of the desk when I saw it online but found there are very limited (if any) examples of how to configure a work space that has a monitor and a laptop. Most of them just show a very minimal laptop. I like to sit in the morning and stand in the afternoons and I don’t always have the time or energy to take it all apart completely and restructure it just for that. It’s not a big deal and is really just my preference. I also wish WFH sold chairs for this desk. I’m currently looking for a comfy bar stool that I can use when I want to sit so I don’t have to take the whole desk apart. I get compliments on this desk alllll of the time. Overall I would recommend this desk for those who want to maintain a clean and modern aesthetic and those who like a large desk area. The desk itself, meaning where you do your work not the whole unit shelves and all, is pretty big and that is my favorite part of this product. I can have a notebook open, my key park and mouse, and my laptop on the desk without it being overcrowded. I know this company is fairly new which is why I’ve provided a lot of feedback but I want to make clear that I really enjoy this desk and would recommend it.
title: Working from home with a WFH Desk
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I love this desk. I would give it 5 starts but the way the surface sits isn't 100% on the bottom part to stabilize the desk surface. It rocks and I've looked over the parts and it's just off by half inch creating a rocking noise. I put paper between the wood to secure it better. The top wood can sometimes chip off when you pushing pieces into other pieces. Three locking parts chipped easily. 
I love this desk and love that you can build onto it. I just didn't like that I paid over $800 for this desk and it has alignment issues. If that wasn't a problem it would be 5 stars
title: Great desk, a few things that could improve
reply.body:
Hi Amber, 

Thanks for the review. The desk top doesn't need to touch the cable management tray to be stable. It is designed to be close but not tight. We would welcome you reaching out to us via email about the chipped parts and we can look at replacing those.
reply.title: Work From Home Desks
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: I have loved my WFH Desk. It was amazingly simple to assemble and super sturdy. I love the look of the natural wood.

reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I did order the wings and have found them to be a tad difficult to use for heavy (printer, etc.) items. What I tried was to place them above the desktop and used neoprene rubber and nylon washers in an attempt to"level" them. I They seem to work ok but still could use additional support. I think a vertical support beneath the wing that clips into the precut shelf slots could be provided to correct the wonkiness (yep, that's a valid description). 

 Overall, I like the desk. Wings need a tweak. (I can send a photo if you let me know where to send it).
title: Great idea, needs some work
reply.body:
Hi Mark,

Thanks for the review. Glad to hear you like your desk but sorry the wing shelves haven't worked out as planned. Yes they can be frustrating and do at times need readjustment. Have you checked out our video on how to get them flat? The trick is to get the taper key down as far as possible, by wiggling the wing as you press it down. You can see that video here... https://player.vimeo.com/video/502883274

Here to help.
reply.title: Work From Home Desks
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

reply.body:
Thanks for the review. The keys on your shelves are a taper design and need to be pushed in a lot more than they are. Please check out this video. The wiggle of the wing trick will help a lot to get them level. 
https://player.vimeo.com/video/502883274

reply.body:
Thanks for the review. The wing / stand is rated to carry 5 laptops that size so we are guessing but can't see that your taper key needs adjustment? Check out this video about how to get the taper key firmly installed. The wiggle trick as you push down is helpful. https://player.vimeo.com/video/502883274

Hope that helps improve your experience. Thanks!

body:
The desk is well constructed and easy to assemble. It fits perfectly into a fairly small space in a bedroom. While fairly small, it fits the bill perfectly, especially with the additional laptop stand.

I am also pleased with the (optional) well designed mat that sits on desk and provides perfect padding for a mouse or pen and paper. 

One small point to note: the desk can be mounted at several different heights, but realistically, for an average sized adult, it needs to be mounted at the highest level, but when you do this, it only leaves a very small gap between the desk and the monitor stand. I would have preferred for the to be a bigger gap - say another 10cm - for it to be a useful additional storage space.

One other suggested improvement: make a slide-out under desk keyboard tray to further increase the versatility of the well thought out desk.
title: A perfect addition to a spare bedroom

This desk works great for me personally, but for a sitting desk that is billed as ergonomic, I wish companies raise the bar so-to-speak by, at minimum, providing a desk that can accommodate the average American desk-worker. Is that so much to ask?

A little strength was required to put together a few things, but I persevered, and there we are, up and running within a few minutes. The only thing is I don't quite understand how the cable tray is meant to work.... it's together correctly, but I can't figure out how to feed the cables through gaps which are too narrow for the ends of some of my cables. 
Having said that, I will, once I am ready, order some additional pieces to complement the set up. Thanks for a great product!

I love how easy it is for me to move from standing to sitting without having to adjust a surface, knock over a glass, unplug something important, etc. All the things I was battling in the past! Also, their customer service is AMAZING! One of the pieces had MINOR damage from shipping (likely from the unprecedented rains in CA). I sent them a quick note to let them know, didn't seem to impact the function, but wanted it on record in cased something changed. They responded within 30 minutes of my note and said they were shipping out a replacement piece that day (which they did). I recommend this to anyone who wants simple, functional, and beautiful craftsmanship for their home office!

body:
I am quite happy with my WFM desk and shelves. Standing and having monitors at eye level has significantly decreased my shoulder and neck pain and has increased my focus. The desk is quite nice to look at, and was relatively easy to put together. 
I have some minor complaints that prevented me from giving it 5 stars: There are no written instructions provided with the desk, so when you open it initially it takes a bit to orient to all the pieces. I was able to put it all together relatively quickly, but there was some back-tracking and re-doing (I later realized there are instructional videos on the website, but did not know that at the time). The "wing shelf" with the laptop stand doesn't stay level, and I do not use it. No matter how well wedged-in the stabilizing piece is, it dips down somewhat. However, generally I am quite happy with this purchase.

body: This desk was quite easy to assemble, even with the incomplete instructions. I would have been MUCH happier had there been detailed instructions for assembling my particular item(s) as opposed to a general one sheet. It wasn't even possible to find them online. This is a shortcoming that should be addressed. Not including them or making them super clear and easy to find, is a branding issue, I think. With this brand, you expect for everything to be very clear, organized and easy to understand. Don't assume that all of us know exactly how to assemble these things. For example, I ordered some extra side shelves for the desk. There was absolutely no instruction on how to attach them nor was it made clear that they needed to be attached to the side legs BEFORE, you assemble the rest of the desk because of the short distance between the side slots for shelve placement.. I had to take the entire desk apart and re-assemble it just to attach the second shelves. ALSO, can't switch these to different places or heights once the desk is assembled, making the shelves difficult to use. Finally, the shelves are super unstable and sit at awkward angles because there is only the single peg for the slot that holds them in place. This is a serious design flaw. The shelves are expensive. If I'm going to pay for them, then I expect for them to be easy to move around, raise, lower and balance. I shouldn't have to be afraid to put weight on them.

body:
I bought the laptop stand to work from home and researched a number of products before buying. 
I decided on this stand as it is a sustainable material, NZ made, not much more expensive than cheap imported rubbish, and it looked good (a good working environment is important!).
I am so pleased: this is very well made, looks fab and does the job perfectly. Plus it was speedy, personal service.

In saying that, I have made a teeny tiny modification that might be considered going forward - I found the angle of my screen too vertical and needed a little bit more backwards lean to it, so I glued some 12mm rubber bungs to the bottom of the front vertical supports to give it that little incline. Including those as an option might be worthwhile, and now I am 100% happy with this product. 
I would absolutely recommend this stand, and if you have the same problem that your laptop screen only goes back so far, the rubber feet/bungs are an easy fix.

body:
I wanted a permanent standing desk (to reduce the risk of me just lowering it all the time) that looked good in my lounge and was simple to adjust (no electronics or gears that could break). This desk fit that need perfectly! 

The great:
I was impressed with the quality of the materials and how nice it looked. It fit together well and was easy to put together. The main table and top shelf are sturdy and I feel I can lean a bit on the table and it holds up well.

The not so great:
The shelf holding the Laptop feels like it could do with more support. It may be super strong as far as I know, but it droops slightly under the weight of the laptop and my hubby and I didn't trust it at first... The holder that actually holds the laptop also is super rickety. I wouldn't trust my cats being on the table as I'm sure they could probably nudge it off. 

The subtly bad: 
The image in the promo shots shows a plant holder, and I assumed it came with the bundle. Only after did I see a little *Not all items in photos are included in bundle
I feel this was a bit of false advertising -- the plant holder was one of the draws for this bundle, why show everything else in the picture coming with the bundle EXCEPT the one thing???

All in all I'm happy I got this bundle, and I did eventually put my laptop on the rickety holder - it's holding up for now!

body:
This is an excellent quality product for flat pack furniture- the materials, ease of assembly and even packaging speaks volumes in the time, effort and engineering that has been put into this desk. I am also impressed at how quickly it arrived; I was not expecting it to arrive on Monday after just ordering it mid-day on a Friday.

I purchased the natural birch wood product, it is very nice but slightly a lighter color than I was expecting. However, I expect this to darken or potentially yellow over time from UV like most wood products. 

Interesting though I received a savings discount e-mail just after placing my order. So I suggest that if you are looking to buy extra accessories to consider waiting until you receive this additional discount after your initial order. This must be an up-sale marketing strategy so wait for this as the business will not retroactively provide a discount to your initial order.

body: I’ve been wanting to stand up in front of my computer for years. And as I’ve been spending more and more time in front of my computer, by the end of the day I was beginning to feel like a T-Rex; hunched, stooped, and sore. And so, I finally bit the bullet and bought a WFHD. It arrived quickly, was super easy to put together (I’m not one for reading instructions), and I’ve adjusted it to the perfect height for me. (I’m 178cm or 5”10inches. And I could even go higher if I wanted to) I love the colour. And the design is cool. Minimal and so cleverly put together. Everyone I’ve shown it to has been inspired to do the same. Of all the stand up desk styles out there (and there are soooo many), I thoroughly recommend a Work From Home Desk. I know this sounds like a paid rave, but they really are the best desks in terms of style, design, build quality, colour choices and importantly, price point. Couldn’t be happier.

reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I'm really happy with this desk. I put the whole unit together (three times, should've planned better) by myself. It would have been nice to have another body/set of hands a couple of times but, using my arms and legs creatively, I was able to get everything together, even the three shelf bookcase I added to my order.

I'm not certain the wing shelves can hold the weight they're shown to, but, I also trust the company so, if/when I need them, I will try them. With the bookshelf, I really haven't found a need for the wing shelves and, with the top shelf holding my second monitor and laptop, I don't need the laptop wing.

I'm keeping an open mind but, so far, this is the perfect amount of workspace, it is attractive, and, if I have to, I can disassemble it all and store it away. 

My recommendation for anyone putting this together is to start with the lower shelves so that you have room to put the keys in and use adjacent slots, otherwise, you need to separate shelves by one slot to get the keys in.

Last, I had reached out to customer service with an issue and, not only did I receive a response quickly, the person I worked with heard me and resolved the issue quickly and to my satisfaction. I feel very confident in the company and the product and have already recommended it to others.
title: Perfect

body: My desk arrived on time and in perfect shape — I also really appreciate that all of the packaging is recyclable paper and cardboard (no styrofoam, yay!). Assembly was beyond simple, and I love that I can alter the height and move the wing shelves I got if I want to rearrange the room. Best of all, this is easily the most comfortable and ergonomically correct desk I have ever had at home. Sitting at it all day is an absolute pleasure. I bought a foot rest and a desk pad — both were sort of splurges, but 1000% worth it, too—if you’re at all on the fence about getting a desk pad, it really is a high quality and tremendously comfortable surface. I had a small issue, and Work From Home Desks had it taken care of a half hour (at most) after I sent an email. This sounds a little corny, but I LOVE this desk, and they are a fantastic company. I would recommend this to anyone in a heartbeat.

body: I'm curious if this will get deleted. I greatly enjoy my desk, I have the double desk module, a top shelf, wing shelves, it's all great. My main issue with this company comes from the fact that everything's always "on sale," and it's even worse than it used to be: 35% off is a greater "discount" than previous, but everything is significantly more expensive (Wing Shelves were $95 after "sale"). It makes actual sales completely pointless cause no one is going to notice
title: Great product, bothersome marketing
reply.body: Thank you for the honest review. We hear you and respect that viewpoint. In many ways, we totally agree with you. In fact for the first five years when we were just Fiasco Cases we never offered any discounts at all. Some loved that, some hated it. We have since tested a range of ideas both on the case side and with WFH Desks when it comes to price and sales. What we have concluded is that people love a sale. People are so conditioned to a sale that if we don't make one our sales go down. We haven't created that phenomenon but it does exist and we have tested to prove it does. Perhaps even more so in online sales because it takes minimum effort to search up a website at home compared to the level of commitment you feel when you drive to a store to buy something. Leaving with nothing from the store would feel like a waste of time. Closing your browser window is something you do in a moment. Our goal is to make great products and sell them at a fair price. As you have said we make a great product. So hopefully you'll forgive us if we have to get creative with how we grab attention in a busy world to sell them. Enjoy the desk. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review and engage with us. Joe and the wider team.
reply.title: Work From Home Desks
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: I'm so glad I decided to try this desk. Flatpack furniture isn't exactly my favourite thing in the world, but when I learned about the easy tool-free assembly I thought it'd be good to give this a go. Anyway, when it turned up the set up couldn't be simpler. Everything had instructions printed on the packaging, and the whole experience of slotting it all together and fixing in place with the keys isn't just easy but it's fun. Set up, the desk is substantial in workspace area, and gives a reassuring feel of stability. I use the main section standing and the side section as a seated option if I need it. Having the top shelf, middle shelf and a few hooks makes the desk perfect for my needs. Aesthetically, it's a great neutral but modern look. Being able to pack it down and move elsewhere or store is a great feature that I'm sure I'll may use of soon. Give these desks a go!

title: Better than expected
reply.body: Thanks for the review. Plywood is not "particle board". It is real wood that has been thinly shaved into layers and then bonded in opposing layers to create strength and dimensional stability that is not possible to achieve from solid timber. As you have discovered it is superior to particle board and not cheap. Enjoy the desk.

title: Love my new desk!
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
Our WFH desk was my grandfather's, a solid timber 10-drawer desk made when things were made properly to last for generations (well, at least three generations for this desk). While OK for occasional use, trying to squeeze in laptop, screen, peripherals and work 'stuff' after a move out of the office was getting a little frustrating. I relocated to the dining room table - less than ideal, and I was soon dragging everything back to get dumped on the spare bed. Apparently tables are for glasses not laptops...

>Googling sounds<

*click* and a new desk was on the way. 

Whoever designed WFH's packaging deserves a Nobel prize for the sheer brilliance in how it all goes together, and that it's all recyclable.

'Hmm, how does this go together..' For once, this male's lack of following instructions was not smirked at by his wife. We had our corner standing workstation set up in about 5 minutes, with no spare parts left over. If only motorcycle maintenance or building Lego was this easy. 

Ta dah, Home Office transformed with a stylish practical desk. Plenty of nooks for stuff, hooks for things and shelves to, well, shelve. Even found space for a potplant or two. Our new desk is super stable too, easily brushing off our 5 year old's best attempts to apply his own version of the Chaos theory.

Thankyou, WFH, for allowing us to realise the full potential of not being in a cube farm office for 8 hours a day (plus commute).

PS Our cat also says thanks for making her humans a little happier :)
title: Simply the best desk we've owned

body:
I bought this desk over 6 months ago and I'm really happy with it, the quality is great and it's really easy to assemble and disassemble to store if necessary.

The desk is on the small side of desks so make sure to check if it fits everything you want to put on it. In my case I just wanted it for my monitor, laptop, keyboard and mouse and it fits well (but there is not a lot of extra space).

For someone looking to buy this desk, the only recommendation I have is to think whether the standing version of the desk might be a better fit. I've been working from home a lot more since I bought this one and it'd have been useful to be able to work standing up during this time.

body:
I’ve had my desk for quite a while now. In that time I’ve needed to move my desk at least a dozen times. The ease with which it disassembles (and can even be moved all at once in-a-pinch - it fits through doorways fully assembled!) has been a god-send these past couple of years.

Moving so often this has forced me to be critical with desk junk (i.e. if it put this speaker there do I want to haul it when I next move my desk?). I’ve found the design of the WFH of desk has allowed for a minimalist workspace, reflective of its own aesthetic, which in turn makes the inevitable next move just that bit easier.

body: The August21 lockdown saw the two of us needing to work from home with immediate effect. After some urgent and extensive research we found two desks from Work From Home Desks that suited our needs. We bought the WFH Sitting Desk for Her and the Standing Desk for Him plus the bookshelf module. Despite the lockdown, the product arrived ahead of the delivery timeframe. Even without using the instructions it was still super easy and really quick to assemble (disclaimer: we like puzzles!). The laptop stand allows us to have two 24inch monitors on the sitting desk and we also have a laptop + two 24inch screens on the standing desk. Both desks and the bookshelf easily fit in our bedroom (room dimension approx. 2.55m x 5.18m), suits our needs and look incredibly stylish too! This has definitely been a worthwhile investment for us. Kiwi ingenuity at its best!
title: Easy to Order! Fast Delivery! Clever Design! Worthwhile Investment!
reviewer.location.country.name: New Zealand

There are a few minor defects in the plywood + one gouge in the finish of the table top, so that’s why I am not going five stars. 

But I recommend. It is a good solution to be able to easily switch between seated and standing positions throughout the work day.

body: The standard desk height is ergonomically too high for me. I have a desk job, for many years I have suffered from lower back and hip pain, even when using a footrest. In the office I have an adjustable desk, so it's set to low position so I can have my feet flat on the floor (no footrest required). My back and hip problems were ellivated. Due to Covid 19 lockdowns I was required to work from home, I needed a desk. The WFH desk fulfilled all my ergonomic requirements, and fits into the small space I have for my home office. My WFH desk set to the lowest position, after months of working from home my back and hips are as happy as Larry.

title: Awesome desk
reviewer.location.country.name: New Zealand

body:
My son was having his bedroom renovated and as he needed a desk to not only hold his Playstation, his school laptop and his video editing computer along with a large 32inch screen we had a bit of a challenge on our hands to find a desk that was sturdy enough but also compact enough to fit in the limited space and of course to accommodate everything.

After calling them and chatting about our predicament we ended up going with the 
WFH Desk, the Mid Shelf and for a bit of extra storage we added the Book Shelf Module and the Desk Pad, all in the black... very stylish ;)

It arrived super quick (3-4 days from memory) and was in perfect condition. Took less than 20mins to assemble and the great thing about it (over and above how cool it looked) was it had no screws or those annoying alan keys! It just fit together with these small 'wooden keys' all made out the of the same black finished plywood.

I really can't say anything bad about the product... 6 out 5!
title: A little extra storage never hurt anyone :)

body:
My husband and I ordered two Standing Desk Essentials bundles and added the front and mid shelf accessories to connect the two in the middle so we could have space for our printer and a couple house plants. We LOVE these desks. We live in a tiny home (just over 450 square feet) and these desks are a great size. I love that we have the option to take them completley apart and store flat when we have company. The desks are sturdy, a beautiful blonde color, and roomy. I've set my desk up for sitting and my husband uses his for standing. Shipping was extra speedy and the desk pieces were packaged really nicely. Everything made it safely with the exception of a small indentation on one of our desk tops (but I'm not sure that happened during shipping because the shipping box looked pristine). You honestly cant even tell it's there unless you run your hands over it. After removing everything from.the packaging the setup was as easy as they show in the videos with the exception of the supporting pieces that fit together across the back of the desk. I had to apply a bit more pressure than I was comfortable with to get the two positioned correctly to insert the wood "lock". Overall, I'd 100% recommend if you can afford it. 

Thank you WFH for engineering a home office setup that can work for tiny spaces! This is exactly what we were looking for.

Since it is a hassle, I ended up removing decorative items from the desk, since I have to always remove and put back once I am done converting from stand up to sit down. It is nice and small however. I would not repurchase however. The price seems high, however, I think that is because of the craftsmanship and assembly of the desk. The desk has cracks on the bottom holder after converting after a few times. Overall, not the happiest with the purchase.
title: Ok Desk.
reply.body:
Hi Jose,

Thanks for the review. Sorry to hear it hasn't lived up to your expectations. As you say, there are some trade offs with being able to pack it away, its size, and its ability to move up and down as easily as an electric desk. We keep learning on how to describe those trade offs and will take these comments on board for our marketing. 

We are concerned about your comment regarding cracks. Please can you email us photos of those so we can review. 

Thanks

title: Sturdy Little Shelf
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I highly recommend this desk. When the pandemic hit my partner and I were fortunate enough to be able to work full-time from home. However, we didn’t have office space for 2. I spent the first few months uncomfortably working on the couch or at the kitchen table, because I didn’t want to invest in a permanent work from home space. I was attracted to the WFH desk because I wanted the flexibility to be able to take it down and store it, and also liked the idea of having both a standing and sitting desk.

I’ve now had the desk over a year, and I absolutely love it. It arrived flat packed and well protected. The quality and finish is wonderful. The edges are sanded attractively and the surfaces are smooth and satisfying to touch, and have held up well to daily use and even through a move to a new house. The pieces fit together tightly, and somewhat intuitively, and the assembled piece is solid and sturdy. It doesn’t wobble or rock at all, which I was worried about before I purchased. When I sit at it I don’t feel like I’m using temporary furniture. It also looks very nice.

I like that the desk surface can be positioned on a variety of levels, I’m tall and I have it in a position where I can fit comfortably under it-which isn’t something I’m used to from my static office desks. I really like the shelves above the desk surface, they are perfect for storing office supplies and for placing my Zoom lighting for the video calls that have become the new normal. The slots in the side and back panel are also handy for organizing the various cords for my laptop. 

While the desk is pretty easy to assemble and disassemble (and can be done by one person) it takes enough effort that I do not switch between standing and sitting positions during the day the way I had thought I might. However, I still really like the option of taking it apart and storing it, especially if my work ever shifts back to being mainly outside the home, I could see setting it up for the occasional at home day and having it out of the way the rest of the time.
title: Highly Recommended Flexible Desk Solution
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: I love the desk & would highly recommend. Assembly took me 10 minutes. Looks great in my small apartment. Doesn’t take up a lot of space & easy to store.
title: Love my WFH desk
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I needed a workspace for a guest room. My requirements were something that could be packed away or folded down, yet sturdy enough for daily use. I bought the original WFH desk and was pleasantly surprised at the fast shipping (even during the pandemic) and ease of building the desk. Not long after, I bought the standing desk and extra shelf. 

I'm really happy with my home work space. It's versatile and has a small footprint. The wood is smooth and looks great. The design of the WFH desk allows for easy cord management, and the ability to sit or stand is a nice bonus.
title: Exactly what I needed
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: When COVID hit and our university shifted to all-remote teaching, I quickly had to create a Zoom classroom at home. I scoured the internet for standing to sitting desks: Because I was teaching for hours every week, I had to be able to stand or sit and change the setup quickly when needed. I also needed space for a laptop and a large monitor to the side so that I could see all of my students. How was I going to find something compact enough and flexible enough to do all of this?? Most adjustable desks were bulky and crazy expensive. Thank the teaching gods that the WFH desk popped up in my search!! It is compact, sleek, easy to assemble and to switch up quickly. Bonuses: it’s pretty, sturdy, well-made (my carpenter husband vouches for this), and looks great in the space. I have the monitor stand, a front shelf, and a couple of wing shelves, so everything I need is in reach. I have returned to in-person teaching, but I still do all of my prep, grading, and zooming from my WFH desk at home. I thought I would store it once we were back to face-to-face classes, but it looks like I will be selling my old, larger home office desk and keeping the WFH as my permanent set up. THANK YOU, WFH peeps! This is a great product!
title: *Lifesaver* for a teaching-from-home prof
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: I was happy with the entire experience. I called and asked some questions that were quickly answered, shipping was fast and the desk is easy to put together although an extra set of hands is helpful. I have taken it apart and changed the height and taken it to school now that we are back and I love it. People always compliment the design when they see it. Thank you for such an innovative product.

But it's great and I'd definitely recommend it.

reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
it's well made, but it is not really flexible or as easy as it sounds to adjust the height. 

moreover, the addition components, such as that laptop holder on the side is not very stable

the height adjustment is not fine enough, maybe sitting down is fine, or maybe it's just for my height, when using it as a standing desk, there is always some feeling the height is not right, because you can't adjust the height just taller a bit, it's like couple inch each time you go up or down. it's just missing the fine adjustment, which could pretty frustrating. I have to buy something like standing matt, and desk mat to make up the final gap. 

I have used it over a year and bought a few accessories, I guess I will have to stick with it.
title: Well Built, but it's not as flexible as I like
reply.body:
Thanks for the review and feedback. Sorry the desk hasn't lived up to your expectations. We will take your comments on board. 

Regarding the laptop holder, you may find it helpful to review this video. Giving the wing a wiggle as you press down firmly on the taper key is helpful to firm it up. https://player.vimeo.com/video/502883274
reply.title: Work From Home Desks
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body: Overall this desk fits perfectly in a small corner of my apartment, I recently got a work from home job and wanted to officially have a desk. I use this desk as a sitting desk primarily and am short-legged (height 5'3'') and am still trying to see what add-on's I may need including the right type of chair, because my arms are angled up when I type and I can tell causes some soreness, so hoping to see with my new job the set up and see if adding on some of the extra features helps make it more ergonomic. My boyfriend kept commenting on how it was so easy to put together and exactly as I expected. Overall really happy with this and how modular it is, plus definitely sturdy and high quality, got delivered efficiently - I highly recommend if you need a desk in a space that's multi use.

body:
This desk is great for those on the move. Over the summer I traveled a lot and it was a life saver. I was able to set it and tear it down in just a few minutes.

One downside, you need to make sure to move it and wrap it carefully as the external wood laminate can chip and peal. This isn't very noticeable in the natural color, but I would imagine the black would be very noticeable.

The packaging it came in was sufficient, but I expected more. It would have been nice if there was an option to order a protective carrying case or some form-fitting box which I could repack. It came plastic wrapped -- no damage.

The surface is great and water resistant. The height settings are perfect, but adjustment takes time.
title: Great portable desk
reply.body: Thanks for the review. You will be pleased to know a new and improved box is coming out in the next month or so. No plastic... and you will be able to reuse it for travelling the desk if you kept it.

body: I had been dreaming of this desk for a long time, but it was very much out of my price range, and to be honest, it felt like it was overpriced. When WFH started selling factory seconds, I was finally able to afford one and since it was really the only thing I could find that fit my needs, I decided to purchase one. I am so glad I did! This desk is so, so nice and functional. It feels so sturdy and had space for all of the things I need. It works perfectly for my double monitor set-up, has space for my printer, space to write, and more. It's also great quality and I love the way it looks and fits in my small office space. My friend is dying for one after seeing it. I will also say, the factory second version has almost nothing wrong with it, which was a nice surprise. It was missing one of the pegs that holds the shelves in place, but it hasn't been an issue to not have it.
title: Great desk

body: My overall experience with WFH Desks has been pleasing--I am a huge fan! That being said, the 2 Wing Shelves that I purchased for my WFH Desk definitely add work space + overall functionality to my desk/work area; however, the wings, themselves, seem to have a slight downward slant away from the attachment/desk. My husband and I have tried to figure out a way to shore up the wings to make them level, but have not been able to figure out a solution yet. Either way, the slight downward angle away from the desk hasn't hampered my ability to utilize this additional space in any way -- just more of a concern about the weight/pressure being put on the connection sites for these pieces in particular. That being said, I love my WFH Desk space and this company, overall!

body: I was fortunate to come across an ad for WFH when I was searching everywhere for a desk flexible enough for my needs. Every desk I found was too tall for me because I prefer to sit quite low when I'm writing, so the fact that the lowest slot on my WFH desk is much lower than anything else I had found was a big selling point. I also like to stand to work about half the time, so the fact that it's adjustable is wonderful, and since it's extensible adding a second surface means I don't even need to adjust it ever, I have one side for sitting and one for standing. While it's a little pricey, I've found it to be totally worth it. After suffering for many years with back pain, this is something worth splurging on. And compared to other sit-stand solutions, the price actually isn't bad at all. Plus I prefer that this requires no electric motor or anything else that's gonna break or not be usable during a power outage, and the overall "framework" look that results from the rearrangeable design makes it really stand out as an intriguing artistic space but also spare and subtle enough that it doesn't clash with the rest of the room - stylistically it just merges in with whatever other design elements are present. It's very easy and even fun to put together and/or rearrange. I look forward to adding more pieces to it over the years!

Hi Jibril,

We also have a Front Shelf which is narrower and the double wide module lets you buy a second desktop shelf if you needed one. Did you consider either of those for what you need? Would they help? 

If those don't help but something else would then please do let us know. We love to learn and understand how our customers are using their desks.

body: I was looking for an affordable standing desk that looked good and didn't have a huge footprint. The Work From Home Desk ticked all those boxes and more. Assembly was relatively painless, it took me about 10-15 minutes to assemble. I like that I have the option to go from standing desk to sitting in a few minutes, and I can pack the desk away to stow under a bed or sofa if I don't want it in the room.
title: 10/10 desk
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
Aesthetically I love the desk and I’m considering ordering a plywood sectional sofa from another company to match.

I bought this desk thinking that when the pandemic was over it could easily be stored under my bed, but I love it in the space and use it daily. I initially bought it for a laptop and Wacom station, but since owning a desk I love (for the first time) I’m going to be purchasing a large desktop monitor.

The desk is far more structurally sound than I would’ve guessed given the way it’s constructed (the table top is supported/ locked in from near the back), but it’s completely level and can take weight with no issues or flexing. 3/4” plywood doesn’t have the flexibility I thought it would. 

Everything is light weight and easy to assemble by yourself, and to adjust on the fly. 

One thing I’d love to see is some kind of 3M style chord runners for the back of the table - something preserves the clean lines of design without the mess and tangle of chords. It would be nice to have one that would allow me to easily grab my laptop or iPad charger when needed and conveniently put it back into position when I returned home.
title: My favorite piece of furniture.
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I love everything about this desk. Small details were clearly considered in the design. The wood is stunning. I would buy rooms full of their furniture. I also put it together so easily and it was fun, like putting together an easy puzzle.

The only feedback I have is that I wish the side shelves didn't "droop" down a bit. But I'm super picky so I think it's prob just something I notice, lol.
title: LOVE this desk, so well designed
reply.body:
Hey Bridget,

Thanks for the review and love that you love the desk. 

Regarding the side shelves. Yes they can be frustrating and do at times need readjustment. Have you checked out our video on how to get them flat? The trick is to get the taper key down as far as possible, by wiggling the wing as you press it down. You can see that video here... https://player.vimeo.com/video/502883274

Trust that helps.

I haven't shortened it to a sitting desk yet, but it's nice to know that I can if I want to. The simplistic design is aesthetically pleasing, and much more sturdy than the pictures make it look. I've learned on it, bumped into it, dropped things on it, and there's been no worry of my monitors falling or knocking the whole thing over. I definitely recommend this desk!

body: I absolutely love this desk. Everything from the simplicity of putting it together to its minimalist and sturdy design. Putting it together was like game. I temporarily moved across the country from CA to MD and I was able to pack it in my Honda Civic. It’s still in excellent condition and I’ve had it for about 1 year. It takes about 10 mins to put together. The setup that’s working for me is a laptop on a laptop stand, small keyboard, a small monitor on the short ledge in the back against a wall (otherwise it might be a little precarious), and space for writing and additional small items. If you need a full 2 large monitor set up, it will be a tight squeeze. I thought I would be switching from sit to stand but I ended up just standing because it is a little annoying to go back and forth. The plus side is that it does fold away and it’s a portable standing desk. I use it with a standing mat which has helped make standing all day more comfortable. It is pricey but I’m down to pay this for all the pros, the craftsmanship, and the ingenuity.

body:
I had a lovely and expensive standing desk in the office before remote work. I wanted to have a standing desk at home but had some space constraints. I also didn't have an existing desk that I could put a desktop adapter on top of. I bought this due to its narrow width and also the ease of disassembling it if I ever needed the room for something else.

Putting it together was simple. I had it together in under 15 minutes and imagine I could take it down and store it in the same time if needed. It is sufficiently wide enough for a laptop, external monitor, tea cup, with space to have paperwork alongside if needed. I have moved it fully assembled several times to access the wall behind it and had no major problems. What I probably should do is put plastic casters under the legs to easily slide on my tile floor. Maybe that can be a future addition that comes as part of the legs. Otherwise it is a great desk
title: Great desk for small spaces
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

reply.body: Thanks for the review... the taper keys may need to be adjusted from time to time if you get a wobble. Just give them a firm push in as you wobble it and they should tighten up and remove the wobble.

reply.body:
Thanks for the review. Glad to hear you like your desk but sorry the wing shelf hasn't worked out as planned. Yes they can be frustrating and do at times need readjustment. Have you checked out our video on how to get them flat? The trick is to get the taper key down as far as possible, by wiggling the wing as you press it down. You can see that video here... https://player.vimeo.com/video/502883274

Here to help.

body:
WFH desk is great for portability. Being a renter in Nashville in the music industry means you’re moving every year in order to afford rent. 
I saved up for this desk because I needed something that could easily move in a car with me. The added plus was that it could be assembled with no tools.
Though it is somewhat intuitive on putting it together, once it is together it is hard to transition from sitting to standing. It’s not quick. You have to commit to standing or sitting. Deciding to go back and forth can disrupt your work if you’re hyper focused and easily distracted like I am.
All this being said: it is sturdy, it is easy to set up, and the portability is great.
The wing stands work great in my home studio for my monitors and the height is perfect for me.
I would recommend this to anyone looking for a very natural and almost playfully inspiring desk for their home office.
title: Great for portability, but not for transitioning between sitting and standing quickly.

(even an alternate laptop that’s not in use). Then will be able to use for monitor if I ever do convert to sitting mode. Great versatile accessory, recommend
title: Monitor stand becomes plant stand
reviewer.location.country.name: United States

body:
I guess the quality is good, it's just not as flexible as what I wish for, but I guess I didn't really know what I was expecting. 

Yes, you can break it down and adjust the height, but that is actually not easy and in fact painful to do (once you have stuff on the desk). I have done it 3 times with different adjustment, it takes generally almost an hour to finish every time. 

Yes, I can buy additional parts to attach to it and make it bigger and wider, etc. But it really doesn't feel good, for example that round small thing on the side for placing your laptop, I don't like it. It's not flat enough, I need to put a small paper book underneath so it can become stable. Also, the laptop located here appears to be too far, if I am facing to the center of the desk. 

Finally, the height.... sigh, it's not fine-tuned enough so it's always not feeling right to me. Unlike those powered standing desk, you can move up or down slightly, but this one you have to move almost a feet each time (?), basically, it's the height of each block. So for my height, it's weird, my arm placement is not really feeling good. 

Anyway, I have used it over a year now, I do like the fact that eventually I can close it, I can. Or maybe I should completely make it as a sitting desk instead of standing desk, then I might feel better. 

Not sure if it helps you or not, but I am stuck with it.
title: Well Built, but it's not as flexible as I like

body:
I had never heard of Work From Home Desk before, but when I decided to upgrade my old secretary desk, I kept coming across their desks and desk kits. They were pricier than I originally wanted to spend, but I spent a lot of time looking at other vendors, and nothing compared. I wanted something fresh and modern, and the versatility offered by Work From Home Desk was a huge plus, too. 

I finally committed and ordered the artist setup. It showed up quickly and was packaged smartly and efficiently. Assembly was easy (I used the guides on the website) and even fun! It was like playing with blocks when I was a kid. 

The desk is all set up in my room now, and I simply love it. It's open and modern looking, exactly what I wanted, gets me standing up when I write instead of sitting down all the time, and offers plenty of space for all my little knickknacks. Definitely a quality product that is worth the investment if you're looking for something special and unique.
title: A Modern Writing Desk
reviewer.location.country.name: United States
